Table of Contents

Class RigidBodyContainer<T>

Namespace
osu.Framework.Physics
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

Contains physical state and methods necessary for rigid body simulation.

public class RigidBodyContainer<T> : Container<T>, IDependencyInjectionCandidate, IDisposable, IContainerEnumerable<T>, IContainerCollection<T>, IContainer, ICollection<T>, IReadOnlyList<T>, IReadOnlyCollection<T>, IEnumerable<T>, IEnumerable, IRigidBody, IDrawable, ITransformable, ISourceGeneratedLongRunningLoadCache, ISourceGeneratedDependencyActivator, ISourceGeneratedHandleInputCache where T : Drawable

Vertices

Contains discrete positions on the surface of this shape used for collision detection. In the future this can be potentially replaced by closed-form solutions.

protected List<Vector2> Vertices

Property Value

Vector2

Restitution

Controls how elastic the material is. A value of 1 means perfect elasticity (kinetic energy is fully preserved). A value of 0 means all energy is absorbed on collision, i.e. no rebound occurs at all.

public float Restitution { get; set; }

Property Value

float

Integrate(Vector2, float, float)

Performs an integration step over time. More precisely, updates the physical state as dependent on time according to the forces and torques acting on this body.
